    <span id="ctl00_MainContent_DetailedOutput"><h1 class="title">Witchwyrd</h1>Witchwyrds are four-armed humanoid creatures with hairless blue-gray skin and glowing yellow eyes. They are typically 6-1/2 feet tall and weigh 300 pounds. Their hands possess three evenly sized and spaced digits in a tripod-like arrangement. Witchwyrds conceal most of their faces, leaving only their eyes unmasked. Their inscrutability is a boon to one of their most significant interests, mercantilism, and many haughty witchwyrds openly revel in the befuddlement inspired by their mysterious guises and mannerisms. Witchwyrds have a keen eye for new opportunities and markets, and a witchwyrd almost always knows when someone is trying to pull one over on them.<br /><br /> When not trying to blend in with the local community, witchwyrds favor outlandish, loose-fitting clothes in bright reds or yellows and a signature conical hat. Witchwyrds tend to prefer the driest, warmest regions of the areas they visit—perhaps an indicator of their mysterious home world.
<br /><br /><b><u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5&General=true">Recall Knowledge - Humanoid</a></u> (<u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=14">Society</a></u>)</b>: DC 24<h1 class="title"><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=486">Witchwyrd</a><span style="float:right;">Creature 6</span></h1><a target="_blank" href="Images\Monsters\Witchwyrd.png"><img class="thumbnail" src="Images\Monsters\Witchwyrd.png"></a><span alt="Uncommon Trait" class="traituncommon" title="Something of uncommon rarity requires special training or comes from a particular culture or part of the world. Some character choices give access to uncommon options, and the GM can choose to allow access for anyone. Less is known about uncommon creatures than common creatures. They typically can’t be summoned. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to these creature is increased by 2."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=159">Uncommon</a></span><span alt="Lawful Neutral" class="traitalignment" title="Lawful Neutral">LN</span><span alt="Medium" class="traitsize" title="Medium">Medium</span><span alt="Humanoid Trait" class="trait" title="Humanoid creatures reason and act much like humans. They typically stand upright and have two arms and two legs."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=91">Humanoid</a></span><br /><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq02065" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 90</i></a><br /><b>Perception</b> +12; darkvision, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=66"><i>detect magic</i></a><br /><b>Languages</b> <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=1"><u>Common</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=2"><u>Draconic</a></u>; one or more planar languages; <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=340"><i>tongues</i></a><br /><b>Skills</b> <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=2"><u>Arcana</a></u> +16, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5"><u>Deception</a></u> +15, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=8"><u>Desert Lore</a></u> +14 (plus one or more Lore skills related to a specific plane), <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=6"><u>Diplomacy</a></u> +15, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=7"><u>Intimidation</a></u> +15<br /><b>Str</b> +3, <b>Dex</b> +3, <b>Con</b> +1, <b>Int</b> +4, <b>Wis</b> +3, <b>Cha</b> +5<br /><b>Items</b> <a href="Weapons.aspx?ID=35"><u><i>+1 ranseur</i></u></a><hr /><b>AC</b> 22, <b>Fort</b> +13, <b>Ref</b> +13, <b>Will</b> +15<br /><b>HP</b> 110; <b>Resistances</b> force 5<br /><b>Absorb Force</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Reaction" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\Reaction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Reaction" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\Reaction_I.png"> (<a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=11">arcane</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=65">evocation</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=75">force</a>) <b>Frequency</b> once per round; <b>Effect</b> The witchwyrd uses a free hand to “catch” a single <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=180"><i>magic missile</i></a> fired at it, as long as it is aware of the incoming <i>magic missile</i>. This absorbs the missile and causes that hand to glow while it holds this energy. A hand that’s holding energy can’t be used for any other purpose except to use Force Bolt. The energy lasts for 6 rounds or until it is released.<hr /><b>Speed</b> 25 feet<br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> <i>ranseur</i> +16 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=175"><u>disarm</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=103"><u>magical</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=192"><u>reach 10 feet</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 1d10+6 piercing</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> fist +15 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=170"><u>agile</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=188"><u>nonlethal</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 1d6+6 bludgeoning plus <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=18">Grab</a></span><b>Arcane Innate Spells</b> DC 23, attack +15; <b>5th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=69">dimension door</a></u></i>; <b>4th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=255">resilient sphere</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=256">resist energy</a></u></i> (x2), <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=315">suggestion</a></u></i>; <b>3rd</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=78">dispel magic</a></u></i>; <b>2nd</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=197">mirror image</a></u></i>; <b>1st</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=124">floating disk</a></u></i> (at will), <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=352">unseen servant</a></u></i> (at will); <b>Cantrips</b> <b>(3rd)</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=66">detect magic</a></u></i>; <b>Constant</b> <b>(5th)</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=340">tongues</a></u></i><br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Force Bolt</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> to <img class="actiondark" alt="Three Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\ThreeActions.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Three Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\ThreeActions_I.png">  (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=11"><u>arcane</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=65"><u>evocation</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=75"><u>force</a></u>) The witchwyrd fires one <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=180"><i>magic missile</i></a> per action spent (dealing 1d4+1 damage each). It can’t spend more actions on this ability than it has free hands. If it uses a hand that has Absorbed Force, that hand hurls two missiles instead of one, expending the held energy.</span><h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Related Creatures" title="Sidebar - Related Creatures" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_4_RelatedCreatures.png"> Alien Allies</h3>While witchwyrds often appear to be solitary creatures, the most successful among them rarely wander the planes and planets alone. High-ranking or wealthy witchwyrds employ a variety of bodyguards to accompany them, and their entourage is usually composed of a variety of strange beings met during their travels.</span>

  <script>
      initiateToggle(document.getElementById('theme-toggle'));

      var initializeSearch = function (search) {
          var button;
          var text;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.lastElementChild;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.lastElementChild;

          if (search) {
              search.addEventListener('keypress', function (e) {
                  if (e.keyCode == 13) {
                      e.preventDefault();
                      if (text.value != null && text.value.length > 0)
                          window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
                  }
              })
          }
          if (button) {
              button.addEventListener('click', function (e) {
                  window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
              });
          }
      };
      var initializeExpand = function (toggle) {
          var targetAttrString = "[data-target='" + toggle.dataset.toggle + "']";
          //target = menu to be collapsed
          var target = document.querySelector(targetAttrString);
          toggle.addEventListener('click', function () {
              var expanded = target.classList.contains('expanded');
              expanded = !expanded;
              if (expanded) {
                  //hide other in group if exists
                  if (target.dataset.group) {
                      var otherExpanded = document.querySelector('.expanded[data-group="' + target.dataset.group + '"]');
                      if (otherExpanded) {
                          otherExpanded.classList.remove('expanded');
                      }
                  }
                  target.classList.add('expanded');
              } else {
                  target.classList.remove('expanded');
              }
          });
      };
      (function () {
          //toggles = link that expands/collapses target
          var toggles = document.querySelectorAll('[data-toggle]');
          toggles.forEach(function (toggle) {
              initializeExpand(toggle);
          });
          //searches
          var searches = document.querySelectorAll('.search');
          searches.forEach(function (search) {
              initializeSearch(search);
          });
      })();
  </script>
</body>
</html>
